      • pendingRoleRequests

        protected java.util.LinkedList<OFSwitchImpl.PendingRoleRequestEntry> pendingRoleRequests
        When sending a role request message, the role request is added to this queue. If a role reply is received this queue is checked to verify that the reply matches the expected reply. We require in order delivery of replies. That's why we use a Queue. The RoleChanger uses a timeout to ensure we receive a timely reply. Need to synchronize on this instance if a request is sent, received, checked.

        public static IOFSwitchFeatures switchFeatures

      • getEnabledPorts

        public java.util.List<OFPhysicalPort> getEnabledPorts()
        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitch
        Get list of all enabled ports. This will typically be different from the list of ports in the OFFeaturesReply, since that one is a static snapshot of the ports at the time the switch connected to the controller whereas this port list also reflects the port status messages that have been received.
        Specified by:
        getEnabledPorts in interface IOFSwitch
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable list of ports

        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitch

        Specified by:

      • flush

        public void flush()

      • flush_all

        public static void flush_all()

      • getListenerReadLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getListenerReadLock()
        Return a read lock that must be held while calling the listeners for messages from the switch. Holding the read lock prevents the active switch list from being modified out from under the listeners.
        Returns:
        listener read lock

      • getListenerWriteLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getListenerWriteLock()
        Return a write lock that must be held when the controllers modifies the list of active switches. This is to ensure that the active switch list doesn't change out from under the listeners as they are handling a message from the switch.
        Returns:
        Listener Write Lock

      • sendNxRoleRequest

        protected int sendNxRoleRequest(IFloodlightProviderService.Role role,
                    long cookie)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Send NX role request message to the switch requesting the specified role. This method should ONLY be called by @see RoleChanger.submitRequest(). After sending the request add it to the queue of pending request. We use the queue to later verify that we indeed receive the correct reply.
        Parameters:
        role - role to request
        cookie - an opaque value that will be stored in the pending queue so RoleChanger can check for timeouts.
        Returns:
        transaction id of the role request message that was sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deliverRoleReply

        protected void deliverRoleReply(int xid,
                    IFloodlightProviderService.Role role)
        Deliver a RoleReply message to this switch. Checks if the reply message matches the expected reply (head of the pending request queue). We require in-order delivery of replies. If there's any deviation from our expectations we disconnect the switch. We must not check the received role against the controller's current role because there's no synchronization but that's fine @see RoleChanger Will be called by the OFChannelHandler's receive loop
        Parameters:
        xid - Xid of the reply message
        role - The Role in the the reply message

      • checkFirstPendingRoleRequestXid

        protected boolean checkFirstPendingRoleRequestXid(int xid)
        Checks whether the given xid matches the xid of the first pending role request.
        Parameters:
        xid -
        Returns:
        true or false

      • checkFirstPendingRoleRequestCookie

        protected boolean checkFirstPendingRoleRequestCookie(long cookie)
        Checks whether the given request cookie matches the cookie of the first pending request
        Parameters:
        cookie -
        Returns:
        true or false

      • deliverRoleRequestNotSupported

        protected void deliverRoleRequestNotSupported(int xid)
        Called if we receive a vendor error message indicating that roles are not supported by the switch. If the xid matches the first pending one, we'll mark the switch as not supporting roles and remove the head. Otherwise we ignore it.
        Parameters:
        xid -
